Package controller

Class AppointmentScreenController

java.lang.Object
controller.AppointmentScreenController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class AppointmentScreenController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This is the controller class for the AppointmentScreen.fxml document and is not meant to be instantiated. This class populates the data for the Appointments table, as well as provide the functionality for the buttons, radio buttons and combo boxes on the screen. page.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Gregory Farrell

  • Constructor Details

    • AppointmentScreenController

      public AppointmentScreenController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      This method is called by the FXMLLoader.load() call contained in the toAppointmentScreen() method of the UserHomeScreenController class. The method populates the table with all of the Appointment data that is in the database. It also populates the Contact combo box used to filter the table by Contact.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      resourceBundle - An unreferenced ResourceBundle object passed automatically
      url - An unreferenced URL object passed automatically

    • onNewAppointment

      public void onNewAppointment(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      /** This method is an event handler on the New Appointment button. When clicked, the button redirects the program to the AddModifyAppointmentScreen and sets the new appointment tracking boolean to true.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Passed from the On Action event listener on the New Appointment button.
      Throws:
      IOException - Exception gets thrown if load() cannot locate the FXML file

    • onUpdateAppointment

      public void onUpdateAppointment(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      /** This method is an event handler on the Update Appointment button. When clicked, the button redirects the program to the AddModifyAppointmentScreen and passes the data from the highlighted Appointment. If no Appointment is selected an alert will notify the user they must select an Appointment.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Passed from the On Action event listener on the Update Appointment button.
      Throws:
      IOException - Exception gets thrown if load() cannot locate the FXML file.

    • onDeleteAppointment

      public void onDeleteAppointment(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws SQLException
      This method is an event handler on the Delete Appointment button. When clicked, an alert will pop up asking the User to verify that they wish to delete the selected Appointment. Upon confirmation, the Appointment will be deleted from the database and the display table updated.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Passed from the On Action event listener on the Delete Appointment button.
      Throws:
      SQLException - Exception gets thrown if the SQL code does not compute properly.

    • loadMonthlySchedule

      public void loadMonthlySchedule(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method is an event handler on the Monthly Schedule radio button. When clicked, the table will repopulate with only Appointments occurring within the next 30 days.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Passed from the On Action event listener on Monthly Schedule radio button.

    • loadWeeklySchedule

      public void loadWeeklySchedule(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method is an event handler on the Weekly Schedule radio button. When clicked, the table will repopulate with only Appointments occurring within the next week.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Passed from the On Action event listener on Weekly Schedule radio button.

    • loadAllAppointments

      public void loadAllAppointments(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method is an event handler on the All Upcoming Appointments radio button. When clicked, the table will repopulate with all Appointments in the database that have yet to occur.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Passed from the On Action event listener on All Upcoming Appointments radio button.

    • onSelectContact

      public void onSelectContact(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method is an event handler on the Contacts combo box. When clicked, the table will repopulate with all Appointments associated with the selected Contact.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Passed from the On Action event listener on Contacts combo box.

    • toUserHome

      public void toUserHome(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method is an event handler for the Back button that sends the program back to the UserHomeScreen. The method loads the FXML document for the UserHomeScreen, passes that to a new scene and then sets the stage with the new scene.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Passed from the On Action event listener on the Back button.
      Throws:
      IOException - The FXMLLoader.load() call will throw this exception if the FXML document can't be found.
